p: Adams, Joseph, In the matter of

Petitioner arrested on May 11, 1854, upon the oath of 2 police officers named Barry & Beecher and committed by Justice Johnston as a fugitive slave; petitioner claimed to have been born free, except for 2 years, when "he was bound as an apprentice" to Dr. Richard Barrett of St. Louis; note included in case file states he was indentured in 1838 or 1839 when Adams was 16 or 17 years old "by the contractor on the Rail Road" by Sangamon County
